The claim was initially reported by The: a conservative-leaning news outlet, shortly after the events at the US Capitol.
XRVision: a firm specializing in facial recognition software, was mentioned as the source of the claim, with a retired military officer allegedly stating that the software matched two Philadelphia Antifa members to individuals inside the Senate.
XRVision denied the claims that images f: and The Washington Times article was later retracted but remains accessible in an archived version.
The claim gained traction on social medi: with individuals such as Rep. Matt Gaetz and Virginia Republican gubernatorial candidate Amanda Chase sharing the story or referencing it in their statements.
